items.q: What is Lovart and who is it for?
items.a: Lovart is an innovative, AI-powered design platform built for creative professionals, including graphic designers, UI/UX designers, marketers, and content creators. Lovart aims to streamline the design process, enhance creativity with AI assistance, and facilitate seamless collaboration. Whether you're a freelancer or part of a large team, Lovart provides the tools you need to produce stunning visuals efficiently.

items.q: How does the AI in Lovart help my design process?
items.a: Lovart's AI acts as your intelligent design partner. It can suggest color palettes, layout options, font pairings, and even generate design elements based on your input. This helps overcome creative blocks, speeds up ideation, and ensures your designs are aesthetically pleasing and effective. Lovart's AI is designed to augment your skills, not replace them.

items.q: Can I collaborate with my team or clients using Lovart?
items.a: Absolutely! Lovart offers robust real-time collaboration features. You can share your Lovart projects with team members or clients, allow them to comment directly on the canvas, and work together seamlessly. This makes the feedback process smoother and keeps everyone aligned, regardless of their location. Lovart is built for teamwork.

items.q: What kind of assets are available in the Lovart library?
items.a: Lovart provides an extensive integrated library featuring millions of high-quality stock photos, icons, illustrations, and fonts. This allows you to find the perfect assets for your Lovart projects without needing to switch between different platforms or pay for individual assets. The Lovart library is constantly updated to provide fresh and relevant content.

items.q: Is Lovart suitable for responsive web design?
items.a: Yes, Lovart is designed with responsiveness in mind. You can easily preview how your Lovart designs will look on different screen sizes (desktop, tablet, mobile) directly within the platform. Lovart's tools help you create fluid layouts and ensure your visuals are optimized for every device, providing a seamless user experience for your audience.

items.question: How are credits calculated?
items.answer:
Lovart has two main credit paths:

  • Agent Credits: Used when AI interprets complex instructions and workflows.
  • Canvas Credits: Used when generating images on canvas, based on size, quality, and model.

Higher quality settings and advanced models consume more credits.

items.question: Do credits expire?
items.answer:
Yes, depending on credit type:

  • Subscription Credits: Reset at the end of each billing cycle and do not roll over.
  • Top-up Credits: Permanent and never expire.

items.question: Can generated content be used commercially?
items.answer: Yes. Users own the commercial usage rights for generated content, but usage must follow the underlying model license (for example Flux or Midjourney terms). You cannot resell the model itself or build a competing model service with the outputs.

items.question: What is Unlimited mode and when can I use it?
items.answer: Unlimited mode is available on eligible plans for non-high-speed generation scenarios. It is designed for broader exploration and is protected by fair-use and anti-abuse rules.

items.question: What is the refund policy?
items.answer: Refund requests are supported within 7 days for accounts with very low usage (commonly under 20 consumed credits). Contact official support to start the refund process.

items.q: What is Nano Banana AI?
items.a: Nano Banana is a next-generation AI image generation model developed by Google. It delivers exceptional photorealistic detail, superior text rendering within images, and advanced compositional understanding compared to standard AI image models. On Lovart, it is available as part of the Unlimited Slow Generations feature.

items.q: Is Nano Banana free on Lovart?
items.a: Nano Banana on Lovart requires a Basic or Pro subscription. Free plan users have limited access to standard generation models. Upgrading to Basic or Pro unlocks Nano Banana with Unlimited Slow Generations, while Pro subscribers benefit from priority queue placement for faster results.

items.q: How does Nano Banana compare to standard AI image models?
items.a: Nano Banana significantly outperforms standard models in three key areas: (1) Photorealism ‚Äî details like skin texture, fabric, and reflections are dramatically more lifelike. (2) Text rendering ‚Äî Nano Banana can accurately generate readable text inside images, a task where most AI models struggle. (3) Prompt coherence ‚Äî it follows complex, multi-condition prompts more accurately.

items.q: What is 'Unlimited Slow Generations' on Lovart?
items.a: Unlimited Slow Generations is a Lovart plan feature that gives Basic and Pro subscribers unlimited access to premium AI models ‚Äî including Nano Banana ‚Äî without a monthly cap. The 'slow' designation refers to generation queue priority: Basic users share a standard queue, while Pro users receive priority queue access for faster results.

items.q: What is Seedence 2.0 and when will it come to Lovart?
items.a: Seedence 2.0 is the next frontier AI image generation model, expected to deliver significant improvements in generation speed, semantic understanding, and ultra-high-resolution output compared to Nano Banana. Lovart is actively working on integrating Seedence 2.0. Pro subscribers will receive early access once it launches.
